message.content:
cs.CL, cs.IR, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.MM

This paper is likely to belong to the arXiv CS sub-category of cs.CL (Computation and Language) as it deals with crosslingual document embedding, which is a natural language processing task. It also involves the use of bag-of-words features and classification, which are common techniques in this sub-field. 

It could also belong to cs.IR (Information Retrieval) as the paper focuses on crosslingual document retrieval, which is a core task in information retrieval. 

The use of ridge regression and low-rank matrix factorization suggests that the paper could also be classified under cs.LG (Machine Learning) or cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence). 

Finally, the mention of experiments involving multimedia data (crosslingual sentence and word retrieval tasks) suggests that the paper could also be relevant to the cs.MM (Multimedia) sub-category.
